snippet: Ordos, like so many of the country’s hundreds of new towns, is famous for being empty — a symbol, some would say, of the hubris of rampant urbanization. But the few people who live there see it differently.
abstract: City of Ordos, constructed in a desert wilderness at the southwestern edge of China's Inner Mongolia province, is famous for a miniscule population that has left it almost a ghost town; empty city is one of hundreds of planned towns that have come to symbolize for many the hubris and folly of China's rampant, and failed, efforts at urbanization.
lead_paragraph: Ordos, like so many of the country’s hundreds of new towns, is famous for being empty — a symbol, some would say, of the hubris of rampant urbanization. But the few people who live there see it differently.

headline.main: The Colossal Strangeness of China’s Most Excellent Tourist City
headline.print_headline: The Colossal Strangeness of China’s Most Excellent Tourist City
